entry.title: The District of East Lindsey (Electoral Changes) Order 1998
entry.summary: This Order gives effect to recommendations by the Local Government Commission for England for electoral changes in the district of East Lindsey.

entry.title: The Crime and Disorder Act 1998 (Commencement No. 2 and Transitional Provisions) Order 1998
entry.summary: This Order brings into force on 30th September 1998, 1st December 1998 or 4th January 1999 most of the provisions of the Crime and Disorder Act 1998 which are not already in force.

entry.title: The Animals (Scientific Procedures) Act (Amendment to Schedule 2) Order (Northern Ireland) 1998
entry.summary: Article 2 of this Order adds references to ferrets and gerbils and to pigs and sheep, if genetically modified, to the list of animals in Schedule 2 to the Animals (Scientific Procedures) Act 1986 as from 1st January 1999. That Schedule lists animals which must be obtained only from designated breeding or supplying establishments.

entry.title: The Local Government and Rating Act 1997 (Commencement No. 5 and Transitional Provision) Order 1998
entry.summary: This Order brings into force the provisions of the Local Government and Rating Act 1997 which are not already in force. Sections 4 and 7 (visiting forces etc.) are brought into force on 1st October 1998, and the remaining provisions (which relate to the rating of Crown property) on 1st April 2000.

entry.title: The Education (Fees and Awards) (Scotland) Amendment Regulations 1998
The Stockport Healthcare National Health Service Trust (Establishment) Amendment Order 1998

ukm:Subject.Value: NATIONAL HEALTH SERVICE, ENGLAND AND WALES

category.term: NATIONAL HEALTH SERVICE, ENGLAND AND WALES

entry.title: The Yugoslavia (Prohibition of Flights) Regulations 1998
The Royal College of Ophthalmologists (Charter Amendment) Order 1998
The Social Security (Amendment) (Capital) Regulations (Northern Ireland) 1998
entry.summary: These Regulations further amend the Income Support (General) Regulations (Northern Ireland) 1987, the Housing Benefit (General) Regulations (Northern Ireland) 1987, the Family Credit (General) Regulations (Northern Ireland) 1987, the Disability Working Allowance (General) Regulations (Northern Ireland) 1992 and the Jobseekers Allowance Regulations (Northern Ireland) 1996.

entry.title: The Smoke Control Areas (Sale or Delivery of Unauthorised Fuel) Regulations (Northern Ireland) 1998
entry.summary: These Regulations contribute towards the implementation, as respects Northern Ireland, of Council Directive 80/779/EEC on air quality limit values and guide values for sulphur dioxide and suspended particulates (the Directive).

entry.title: The Sulphur Content of Solid Fuel Regulations (Northern Ireland) 1998
entry.summary: These Regulations contribute towards the implementation, as respects Northern Ireland, of Council Directive 80/779/EEC on air quality limit values and guide values for sulphur dioxide and suspended particulates (the Directive).

entry.title: The High Court of Justiciary (Proceedings in the Netherlands) (United Nations) Order 1998
entry.summary: This Order, made under the United Nations Act 1946 pursuant to a resolution of the Security Council of the United Nations, makes provision for criminal proceedings against the two men accused of the destruction of Pan Am 103 over Lockerbie on 21st December 1988, including a trial before the High Court of Justiciary, to be conducted in the Netherlands.

entry.title: The Local Government Act 1988 (Defined Activities) (Exemption) (East Lindsey and Suffolk Coastal District Councils) Order 1998
The Monopoly References (Deletion of Exclusions) Order 1998
entry.summary: The Director General of Fair Trading (DGFT) is excluded by section 50(3) of the Fair Trading Act 1973 (FTA) from making monopoly references in respect of specified forms of supply of goods listed in Part II of Schedule 7 of the FTA. These include specified forms of supply of liquid cows' milk and potatoes to which no process of manufacture (other than dressing or dyeing) has been applied. This Order deletes these exclusions. The forms of supply of milk and potatoes covered by these exclusions were the subject of statutory marketing schemes. All the relevant schemes have now been revoked.

entry.title: Education and Libraries (Competition in Functional Work) (Amendment) Regulations (Northern Ireland) 1998
entry.summary: These Regulations amend the Education and Libraries (Competition in Functional Work) Regulations (Northern Ireland) 1994 by revising certain dates on or after which boards must not carry out functional work (as defined in Article 3 of the Education and Libraries (Northern Ireland) Order 1993) falling within a defined activity (that is to say cleaning of buildings, catering, maintenance of ground and repair and maintenance of vehicles) without subjecting the work to competition in accordance with conditions specified in that Order (regulation 2).

entry.title: The Social Security Amendment (Capital) Regulations 1998
The Health and Personal Social Services (Fund-holding Practices) (Amendment) Regulations (Northern Ireland) 1998
entry.summary: These Regulations further amend the Health and Personal Social Services (Fund-holding Practices) Regulations (Northern Ireland) 1993 (the principal Regulations), which regulate the recognition and operation of fund-holding practices.

entry.title: The Sports Grounds and Sporting Events (Designation) (Scotland) Order 1998
entry.summary: This Order designates the sports grounds, the classes of sporting events played at those grounds and the classes of sporting events outside Great Britain for the purposes of Part II of the Criminal Law (Consolidation) (Scotland) Act 1995. This Order revokes the Sports Grounds and Sporting Events (Designation) (Scotland) Order 1985 and the subsequent Orders amending that Order.

entry.title: Births, Deaths and Marriages (Fees) Order (Northern Ireland) 1998

ukm:Subject.Value: REGISTRATION OF BIRTHS, DEATHS AND MARRIAGES

category.term: REGISTRATION OF BIRTHS, DEATHS AND MARRIAGES

entry.summary: This Order provides for the various fees payable under the Births, Deaths and Marriages enactments relating to:

entry.title: Education and Libraries (Defined Activities) (Exemptions) (Amendment) Order (Northern Ireland) 1998
entry.summary: Under Part II of the Education and Libraries (Northern Ireland) Order 1993 (the Order) work falling within certain defined activities (that is to say cleaning of buildings, catering, maintenance of ground and repair and maintenance of vehicles) may only be carried out by boards if particular conditions are fulfilled.
